title: What’s Happening in Space Policy April 28-May 4, 2024
summary: Here is SpacePolicyOnline.com’s list of space policy events for the week of April 28-May 4, 2024 and any insight we can offer about them. The House is in session Monday-Wednesday. […]

title: SpaceX making progress on Starship in-space refueling technologies
summary: NASA says SpaceX is on track to demonstrate in-space refueling of Starship next year, a critical technology for returning humans to the lunar surface using that vehicle.

title: A new era: Ariane 6 maiden launch campaign gets underway
summary: On July 5, 2023, the Ariane 5 launch vehicle took flight for the last time, thus ending a storied 27-year career for what was Europe’s first heavy-lift rocket. Nearly ten months later, Arianespace is back at the launchpad with its new and advanced heavy-lift workhorse: the Ariane 6.

title: Advisory committee recommends moving FAA commercial space office out of the agency
summary: An advisory committee for the Federal Aviation Administration’s commercial space office has recommended that the office be moved out of the FAA.

title: Relativity Space shares updated view of future Terran R launch site
summary: Relativity Space has made major changes at Space Launch Complex 16 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station, where its Terran R rocket...

title: ESA’s 2022 Astronaut Class Graduates
summary: On Monday, 22 April, ESA celebrated the graduation of its class of 2022 astronaut candidates. The ceremony, held at the European Astronaut Centre in Cologne, Germany, signified the successful completion of basic training for the five European astronaut graduates and the Australian Space Agency’s first astronaut, all now eligible for spaceflight assignments.

title: Space weather requires our attention now more than ever
summary: Solar Cycle 25 is about to hit its peak, making this an important time to increase space weather monitoring.

title: Space Force opens bidding for classified communications satellites
summary: The Evolved Strategic Satcom satellites are for command and control of U.S. nuclear forces

title: Agile Space lands propulsion contract for U.S. Space Force mission
summary: The company was selected by True Anomaly to power a maneuvering spacecraft to be built for the Space Force’s Victus Haze mission

title: Commercial space station module developer Gravitics wins Space Force contract
summary: Gravitics, a startup developing modules for commercial space stations, will use its technologies for tactically responsive space applications for the U.S. Space Force.
